definitions.definition: a tall narrow building, either freestanding or forming part of a building such as a church or castle.
examples: steeple, spire; Moreminaret; turret; bell tower, belfry, campanile; skyscraper, high-rise, edifice; transmission tower "a church tower"Moreminaret; turret; bell tower, belfry, campanile; skyscraper, high-rise, edifice; transmission tower a church tower

definitions.definition: a tall structure that houses machinery, operators, etc.
a tall structure used as a receptacle or for storage.
a tall pile or mass of something.
a place of defense; a protection.
rise to or reach a great height.
examples: he seemed to tower over everyone else
synonyms: dominate "snow-capped peaks towered over the valley"

definitions.definition: (of a bird) soar to a great height, especially (of a falcon) so as to be able to swoop down on the quarry.
